name: ü§°Reporting Event Dashboard
description: This is a new version of the reporting event dashboard. It provides an overview of reporting events which are currently active. There are links to study dashboards and file viewer for examining the files.

name: Dashboard
description: Old version of Reporting Event Dashboard.

name: üîçSearch SAS programs
description: Anna's app to search SAS programs on LSAF for text.

name: üìäGADAM jobs
description: GADAM jobs that have run recently, and their status. Bars can be clicked on to open the log viewer for the selected job.

name: STAR documentation
description: SAS code documentation generated automatically by Doxygen from the SAS code comments. This is hosted on SharePoint. It must be manually re-generated when the code changes, and then uploaded to SharePoint.

name: üè†Studies Info
description: Study level dashboard showing how recently data has been updated.

name: GADAM Data Refresh Events
description: Dashboard focusing on the refreshing of data for GADAM. Shows SDTM, ADAM and Reports along with what days they were run on. Clicking provides detail for files.

name: üêõLSAF sync
description: Analysis of people using the LSAF sync app. Shows what they have synced from LSAF to their PC.

name: Log viewer
description: SAS log viewer which can be used to view logs on LSAF.

name: üëªFile viewer
description: File viewer which can be used to view many files on LSAF. You can navigate the file system to find what you want.

name: üî¨Resource management
description: This was the first attempt at making a dashboard for resource management. It is not used any more, but demonstrates some useful techniques that could be used in future apps.

name: ü¶ôStudy Dashboard
description: This is the dashboard for a specific study, but you can navigate to other studies from here.

name: üòØCode samples for producing Graphics
description: You can see a range of examples of graphs & figures here, produced with either SAS or R. You can then copy the code for use in your own work as a starting point.
